CatDescriptText: James O. Clark, millworker, Beltzhoover, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 24, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you believe there should be another Negro judge in local state courts - Allegheny County Court and the Common Pleas Court of Allegheny County?" Answer reads: "Yes, and the reason is because we only have Judge Homer S. Brown who, incidentally, is doing an excellent job."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James O.Clark wearing light colored button down collared shirt and cap, standing against wall
